title: Question 1
question: How many pairs of cranial nerves do human beings have?

options.label: 08 pairs
10 pairs
12 pairs
14 pairs

title: Question 2
question: Where are the cell bodies and the cranial outlet of the olfactory nerve (NC I) located?

options.label: Olfactory epithelium (olfactory cells). Cranial exit through foramina in the nasal bone
Olfactory epithelium (olfactory cells). Cranial exit through foramina in the cribiform lamina of the ethmoid bone
Olfactory epithelium (olfactory cells). Cranial exit through foramina in the cribiform lamina of the sphenoid bone
Olfactory epithelium (olfactory cells). Cranial exit through foramina in zygomatic bone

title: Question 3
question: Where are the cell bodies and the cranial outlet of the Optic nerve (NCII) located?

options.label: Retina (ganglion cells). Cranial outlet through the optical channel
Iris (ganglion cells). Cranial outlet through the optical channel
Iris (ganglion cells). Cranial exit through the foramen ovale
Retina (ganglion cells). Cranial exit through the foramen ovale

title: Question 4
question: Where does the cranial exit from the ocular nerve [motor (NC III) take place?

options.label: The round foramen
By the superior orbital fissure
By the lower orbital fissure
Through the foramen ovale

title: Question 5
question: Where are the cell bodies and the cranial outlet of the trochlear nerve (NC IV) located?

options.label: Cell bodies in the midbrain. Cranial exit through the round foramen
Cell bodies in the midbrain. Cranial exit through the superior orbital fissure
Cell bodies in the diencephalon. Cranial exit through the superior orbital fissure
Cell bodies in the diencephalon. Cranial exit through the round foramen

title: Question 6
question: What is the component of the trigeminal nerve and what is the location of their cell bodies?

options.label: Visceral motor. Trigeminal ganglion
Somatic engine. Trigeminal ganglion
General sensitive. Trigeminal ganglion
Special sensitive. Trigeminal ganglion

title: Question 7
question: Where are the cell bodies and the cranial outlet of the Abducente nerve (NC VI) located?

options.label: Bridge. Cranial exit from the stylomatoid foramen
Bridge. Cranial exit through the superior orbital fissure
Oblong cord. Cranial exit from the stylomatoid foramen
Oblong cord. Cranial exit through the superior orbital fissure

title: Question 8
question: The facial nerve (NC VII) has which fiber components?

options.label: Motor branchial, special sensitive, general sensitive and visceral motor
Special sensitive, somatic motor and visceral motor
General sensory, somatic motor, and gill motor
Motor branch, special sensory, somatic motor and visceral motor

title: Question 9
question: The Vestibulocochlear nerve (NC VIII) is divided into:

options.label: Vestibular and hearing
Vestibular and Temporal
Vestibular and acoustic
Vestibular and cochlear

title: Question 10
question: Which glossopharyngeal nerve (NC IX) has nerve fibers of which type, and where does it exit the skull?

options.label: It has general and special sensitive nerve fibers. The exit of the skull occurs through the foramen magnum
It has motor branchial, motor visceral, visceral sensitive, special sensitive and general sensitive nerve fibers. The exit of the skull occurs through the jugular foramen
Has motor branchial, visceral motor, visceral sensitive, special sensitive and general sensitive nerve fibers. The exit of the skull occurs through the foramen magnum
It has general and special sensitive nerve fibers. The exit of the skull occurs through the foramen ovale

title: Question 11
question: Where does the vagus nerve exit (NC X)?

options.label: Magnum foramen
Oval foramen
Jugular foramen
Round foramen

title: Question 12
question: The accessory nerve (NC XI) has two divisions, what are they? Where does the skull exit from them?

options.label: Cranial and medullary root. Both come out of the skull through the jugular foramen
Cranial root and spinal root. They leave the skull through the foramen ovale and magnum respectively
Cranial root and medullary root. Exit through the skull through the foramen ovale and magnum respectively
Cranial root and spinal root. Both come out of the skull through the jugular foramen

title: Question 13
question: What type of nerve fiber and what means of exit from the skull of the hypoglossal nerve (NC XII)?

options.label: Somatic engine. Exit of the skull through the hypoglossal nerve canal
Motor gill. Exit of the skull through the foramen ovale
Visceral motor. Exit of the skull through the round foramen
Special sensitive. Exit of the skull through the jugular foramen

title: Question 14
question: The trigeminal nerve is divided into three parts, which are:

options.label: Ophthalmic division, olfactory division and maxillary division
Ophthalmic division, maxillary division and mandibular division
Olfactory division, ophthalmic division and mandibular division
Olfactory division, maxillary division and mandibular division

title: Question 15
question: The nerve responsible for vision from the retina is the nerve:

options.label: Abducente (NC VI)
Oculomotor (NC III)
Trochlear (NC IV)
Optical (NC II)

title: Question 16
question: Which nerves pass through the internal auditory canal?

options.label: Abducent Nerve (NC VI) and Trochlear Nerve (NC IV)
Trochlear Nerve (NC IV) and Optic Nerve (NC II)
Vestibulocochlear nerve (NC VIII) vestibular and cochlear portion; and branch of the fascial nerve (NC VII)
Hypoglossal Nerve (NC XII) and Accessory Nerve (NC XI)

title: Question 17
question: The nerve responsible for the inversion of the tongue muscles (with the exception of the palatoglossus) is:

options.label: Hypoglossal Nerve (NC XII)
Abducent Nerve (NC VI)
Trochlear Nerve (NC IV)
Accessory Nerve (NC XI)

title: Question 18
question: Nerve responsible for the odor sensation, and its type of nerve fiber:

options.label: Olfactory nerve (NCI). General Sensitive
Olfactory nerve (NCI). Visceral engine
Olfactory nerve (NCI). Somatic engine
Olfactory nerve (NCI). Special Sensitive

title: Question 19
question: Of the nerves below, which one does not have mixed nerve fibers?

options.label: Abducent Nerve (NC VI)
Facial Nerve (NC VII)
Trigeminal nerve (NC V)
Glossopharyngeal nerve (NC IX)

title: Question 20
question: Which of the following nerves do not have special sensitive nerve fibers?

options.label: Olfactory Nerve (NC I)
Optic Nerve (NC II)
Accessory Nerve (NC XI)
Vestibulocochlear Nerve (NC VIII)
